data.question: Calibrating 50 ppm of NH3 produces 0 ppm response on a Cl2 sensor and 1 ppm of Cl2 produces about -0.5 ppm of response on a NH3 sensor. Which sensor should you calibrate first?

question: Positive cross sensitivity means this sensor will read ___________ than the concentration of the cross sensitive gas.
Negative cross sensitivity means this sensor will read ___________ than the concentration of the cross sensitive gas.

data.question: What is the minimum amount of chemical that the sensor can “see” (also known as: “Increment of measurement”.)
Exceeding these values in a sensor will likely give erroneous readings, but which one will cause permanent damage to the sensor?
